poem:
Title: "Fragile Proclamation"

Sunak's pledge, on paper, a crumpled song
Not of victory, but failure dressed in veils.
Yet, autumn's claimant looms – wreath of wrong
Borne on Rachel's hopes, yet dreams may fail.

Economic mass, dwindled under noonday glare,
A drawn plan poised on Labour's humble lead,
Hints of growth or fatal despair?
The vessel of our fate, to right or bleed.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rishi Sunak’s promise to grow the economy ‘in tatters’ as UK enters technical recession – business live 12.07pm GMT Q: How will you stop “Rishi’s recession” becoming “Rachel’s recession”? Reeves insists the prime minister must own the downturn, as he’s been in charge since autumn 2022. The economy is now smaller than when Sunak became PM, she says. And she points out that many businesses have helped Labour draw up its plans for growth. 11.53am". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
